column4: Anyone know of an app or anything that would allow messaging to an IP outside a LAN
what are you trying to do?
I have someone trying to access me in ftp, I have the IP, but no way to contact them. Also, I've needed somthing like this for a while.
do you want to setup an ftp server?
No, I have an FTP. But need a way to contact people via IP
just use the IP in place of a hostname
ip instead of hostname for what?
where you would normally put a hostname, just put in the IP of the remote system
I don't think you understand what I'm doing. Say all I have is an IP address, how do I contact them?
without FTP
what protocol do you intend to use?
That's what I'm asking. Is there applications that allow direct IP input?
that's pretty advanced stuff. Look into tap devices, I think they allow bidirectional communication. Also raw sockets
Basically, I'm looking for something that people that are common to the net would use to contact each other via IP addresses. AIM, Yahoo, etc, all use SN. I'd like direct contact.
for simple chat there's old fashioned 'talk'
2 party IRC kinda
you'd probably be better off setting up an irc server
I'm suprised there isn't anything out there for this.
I'm not sure you've thought this all the way through
Sure I have. Why does everyone have to connect to 3rd party servers to chat?
there should be a way to punch in an IP address and chat with someone.
that'd be talk. Or possibly jabber
